result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David A Ferrell

records.addlTxt:
8:37 AM Defendant David A Ferrell in court, in custody.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for David A Ferrell.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Defense files a bond motion on case on 21CF330.  State has not tendered a final offer.  The new file has not had a PH yet.  Court will change the 22CF1193 case to a PH.  Court will set a new status on all tracking files 30 days after.  State will tender a global offer after the PH.  Defense makes further argument on bond.  State objects.  BTC: Bond modification denied.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:01 AM Defendant David A Ferrell in court, in custody.  Atty Jeremy Samuels for Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for David A Ferrell.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Defendant has a new charge and prelim is next week.  ADA Van Schyndel will provide a global offer after the prelim.  The defendant complains to the court about the communication with his attorney.  Atty Samuels to notify atty Henderson.  The defendant wants a global offer next week.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

1:57 PM Defendant David A Ferrell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove appeared by video for David A Ferrell.  Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
